titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the F. S. Joelson Papers
titlestmt.author: by Jennifer Meehan

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Tuesday January 22, 2019 at 06:16

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: The collection consists of material relating to F. S. Joelson and his work as editor of the weekly newspaper, East Africa and Rhodesia, and as author of works on East Africa and colonialism. Material includes typescripts of works by or believed to be by Joelson; correspondence and printed material relating to the publication of Joelson's book Germany's Claim to the Colonies (1939); scrapbooks of clippings from the "Who's Who" column of East Africa; scrapbooks of clippings from other East African newspapers; and front page clippings of East Africa and East Africa and Rhodesia. Also included are originals and reproductions of caricatures and cartoons by Ralph Sallon and others. The collection provides insight into British perspectives on Africa during the colonial period of the early- and mid-twentieth century, and documents - in the form of caricature - many of the key figures of the British colony in East Africa prior to the Second World War.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Purchased from Maggs Brothers Ltd. on the Philip and Margaret Neufeld Fund of the Yale Library Associates, 2008.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The F. S. Joelson Papers is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: F. S. Joelson Papers. General Collection, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Collections are processed to a variety of levels, depending on the work necessary to make them usable, their perceived research value, the availability of staff, and competing priorities. The library attempts to provide a basic level of preservation and access for all collections as they are acquired, and does more extensive processing of higher priority collections as time and resources permit.

This collection received a medium level of processing shortly after receipt by the library in 2008-2009. Processing included rehousing all material in acid-free folders and boxes (original caricatures and reproductions were already individually sleeved), and organization into series based on activity or format.

Information included in the Description of Papers and Collection Contents is drawn from information supplied with the collection and from a brief survey of the contents. Folder titles are supplied by staff.

bioghist.head: F. S. (Ferdinand Stephen) Joelson (1893-1979)
bioghist.p: F. S. Joelson was a writer on African affairs and the founder and editor of the weekly newspaper East Africa and Rhodesia , which ran from 1924 to 1967 and was known as East Africa from 1924 to 1938. His published books include: The Tanganyika Territory (formerly German East Africa): Characteristics and Potentialities (1920), Eastern Africa Today and Tomorrow (1934), and Germany's Claims to the Colonies (1939).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of material relating to F. S. Joelson and his work as editor of the weekly newspaper, East Africa and Rhodesia , and as author of works on East Africa and colonialism. Material includes typescripts of works by or believed to be by Joelson; correspondence and printed material relating to the publication of Joelson's book Germany's Claim to the Colonies (1939); scrapbooks of clippings from the "Who's Who" column of East Africa ; scrapbooks of clippings from other East African newspapers; and front page clippings of East Africa and East Africa and Rhodesia . Also included are originals and reproductions of caricatures and cartoons by Ralph Sallon and others. The collection provides insight into British perspectives on Africa during the colonial period of the early- and mid-twentieth century, and documents - in the form of caricature - many of the key figures of the British colony in East Africa prior to the Second World War.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is organized into five series: I. Writing Files, 1939, undated. II. Other Papers, 1917-1982. III. Scrapbooks, 1930-1972. IV. East Africa and Rhodesia Clippings, 1925-1964. V. Caricatures, 1930-1938.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged alphabetically by title of work.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains typescripts of works about East Africa, including essays and articles by Joelson, some which are signed "Effendi," two unpublished books believed to be by Joelson, and correspondence and reviews of Joelson's book, Germany's Claim to the Colonies (1939).

did.unittitle: An Escape from Imprisonment in East Africa: A True Tale of the War, typescript and sketch map
Sketches from the Tanganyika Territory, typescript
To the Interior by the Central Railway
The Daily Life of the Village
A Tribute to the Women of the Outposts
Correspondence regarding sale of original caricatures
"The Black Slaves of Prussia: An Open Letter Addressed to General Smuts" by Frank Weston
Printed material relating to East Africa
Printed material relating to East Africa

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged into two subseries: East Africa and Thematic and Other.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: These scrapbooks contain clippings of the "Who's Who" column of the East Africa weekly newspaper dating from 1930 to 1939 and featuring caricatures by Ralph Sallon. Four of the scrapbooks contain manuscript indexes of subjects.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Archival Materials note
relatedmaterial.p: Series V. includes other documentation of Sallon's carticatures.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: These scrapbooks contain clippings of articles by particular journalists or on particular topics concerning East Africa, especially Kenya, which were featured in various East African newspapers, including the Kenya Weekly News .

did.unittitle: Lt. Col. C. H. Stockley and Miscellaneous
Lt. Col. C. H. Stockley and General

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains front page clippings of the East Africa and Rhodesia weekly newspaper dating from 1938 to 1964, and of the East Africa weekly newspaper dating from 1925 and 1938.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains original caricatures in pen and ink by Ralph Sallon drawn for the East Africa weekly newspaper with handwritten identifications on the verso, as well as two cartoons by Sallon, three pen and ink and watercolor caricatures by Ernest Scott, and one pen and ink cartoon by L. A. Stronach. Also found are reproductions of caricatures by Sallon, which are unidentified and unsorted and some of which duplicate the originals.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Original caricatures by Sallon are arranged alphabetically by surname of individual depicted. Cartoons and works by other artists and reproductions of caricatures by Sallon are arranged in files at the end.

did.unittitle: Original and clipping, Cartoons by Sallon
Originals, Caricatures and cartoon by others
